episode_event_sub_ep_halloween_2023_sub/: Hmm, a nighttime mystery at the museum...
Great job solving such a peculiar case!

It’s all thanks to Phoebe and her mysterious
power...or, I should say, her “special sense.”

We solved a past case with Mimi’s mysterious
power, too!
Wow, is that so? Then Mimi...
can you guess what I’m hiding?
Hmm... Mimi says there’s something in your pocket!
Impressive!
You found the Pewter Crunchies I was hiding!

*giggle* I brought them so we could eat
them together!
Ahahaha! Well done, Mimi! I had no clue!
Hahaha! Mimi must’ve read Roxanne’s mind!

(Roxanne, Phoebe... You don’t need to have
special powers to solve a case.)

(Whether it’s big or small, what you need is a kind
heart, just like the two of you have.)
Come on, Looker! Let’s eat!

I must say...the more we look at Runerigus,
the more captivating she becomes.

Even though Runerigus began as an ancient
painting, the pattern on her body is unique.

The slab looks like stone, but it’s actually made
of clay, right?
Apparently so.

Minerals are the main components of clay, so you
could say it’s technically stone. How fascinating...

There’s even a possibility Runerigus was once
part of an ancient structure—that she, herself, is
an archaeological remnant.

“Part of an ancient structure”?!
That’s extraordinary!

Have you come across any ruins in your
documents that have a similar composition to
Runerigus, Lenora?

I don’t think we have any documents like that in
my museum.

So, do we need to look at this from an
archeological perspective?
Cynthia?! When did you get here?

It’s said that Runerigus shows horrifying
memories to those who touch it.

We might be able to find out how old the clay
tablets are if we touch her.

How very adventurous! You’re certainly not
afraid to take risks!

That’s definitely a method to consider when
researching Runerigus.

And so, their discussion continued until late
at night...

Shauntal, Cofagrigus is one of your Pokémon too,
isn’t it?
Can you teach me about Cofagrigus?
Of course!
Cofagrigus is the Coffin Pokémon.

Coffins or tombs from ancient times symbolized
a king’s wealth.
Oh, does that mean I look rich?
Hehehe, maybe!

But there’s actually another reason why Cofagrigus
are said to be symbols of wealth.
Cofagrigus love to eat gold, especially if it’s pure!
Wow! That must be expensive!

Well, it’d be nice if we could give Cofagrigus
what they want to eat every day...
But unfortunately, only a king could do that.
A king...

By the way, what’s your Cofagrigus been looking
at this whole time?
Ahahaha! I know!
Hmm?

She’s looking at that gold statue and thinking it
looks yummy!
That’s...Lear’s statue.

I guess it’s made of pure gold. It must
be so different, being actual royalty...

Do you want me to ask Lear if he’ll give us this
statue, Cofagrigus?
Hehe, you two are already close friends.

I’d love to hear stories about the two of you
some day.
